comments.title: A different way to make games

articles.subTitle: Innovative design
articles.description: Godot's Node and Scene system gives you both power and flexibility to create anything.

articles.subTitle: Use the right language for the job
articles.description: Keep your code modular with an object-oriented API using Godot's own GDScript, C#, C++, or bring your own using GDExtension.

articles.subTitle: Dedicated 2D engine
articles.description: Make crisp and performant 2D games with Godot's dedicated 2D rendering engine with real 2D pixel coordinates and 2D nodes.

articles.subTitle: Simple and powerful 3D
articles.description: Godot's 3D nodes give you everything you need to build, animate, and render your 3D worlds and characters.

articles.subTitle: Release on all platforms
articles.description: Deploy your game on desktop, mobile, and the web in seconds. Godot even supports consoles through third party publishers.

articles.subTitle: Open Source
articles.description: Truly open development: anyone who contributes to Godot benefits equally from others’ contributions.

community.title: Get involved
community.text: Join the community and help create a game engine that belongs to everybody.

blocks.name: Code
blocks.description: If you know how to code, you can help by fixing bugs and working with engine contributors towards the implementation of new features.

blocks.name: Document
blocks.description: Documentation quality is essential in a game engine; help make it better by updating the API reference, writing new guides or submitting corrections.

blocks.name: Report
blocks.description: Found a problem with the engine? Don't forget to report it so that developers can track it down.

banner.text: You don't need to be an engine developer to help Godot. Join the development fund and help us make the Godot Engine even more awesome!
